verses.roman:
caidya-śālva-jarāsandha
dantavakrādayo nṛpāḥ
mama dviṣanti vāmoru
rukmī cāpi tavāgrajaḥ

synonyms: caidya-śālva-jarāsandha-dantavakra-ādayaḥ—Caidya (Śiśupāla), Śālva, Jarāsandha, Dantavakra and others; nṛpāḥ—kings; mama—Me; dviṣanti—hate; vāma-ūru—O beautiful-thighed one; rukmī—Rukmī; ca api—as well; tava—your; agra-jaḥ—older brother.
translation: Kings like Śiśupāla, Śālva, Jarāsandha and Dantavakra all hate Me, O beautiful-thighed one, and so does your elder brother Rukmī.
